news.title: Bangladesh's ousted leader Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death
news.summary: The former prime minister was tried by a special tribunal after 1,400 died during a crackdown on unrest in 2024.

news.title: Trump reverses position and urges own party to vote for release of Epstein files
news.summary: "We have nothing to hide," the US president writes after previously resisting publishing the documents.

news.title: Devices that enable keyless car thefts being sold for £20k online, BBC finds
news.summary: It is not illegal currently to own the gadgets but the government has promised to ban them.

news.title: Mysterious drones have been spotted at airports across Europe. How worried should we be?
news.summary: Drones have been found across Western Europe near airports, military bases and power plants, as part of a suspected programme of 'hybrid warfare'

news.title: Police admit unlawful arrest and pay £20k to couple who complained about school on WhatsApp
news.summary: A couple unlawfully arrested over complaints about their child's school say police have paid them damages.

news.title: Two US marines implicated in killing family in notorious Iraq war shooting, expert tells BBC
news.summary: New evidence raises doubts about the longest US war crimes investigation of the Iraq war and how US forces are held to account.

news.title: Man who grabbed Ariana Grande at premiere jailed in Singapore
news.summary: "Serial intruder" Johnson Wen was given nine days in jail for being a public nuisance.

news.title: How my on-air 'brain fog' moment sparked a big debate
news.summary: When the BBC's Zoe Kleinman spoke about going through perimenopause she got a huge response.

news.title: Criminals buy haulage firms to steal lorryloads of goods, BBC finds
news.summary: These tactics and others, such as raids on lorries stopped in traffic, are driving a freight-crime surge.

news.title: Snow and ice warnings issued by Met Office as sub-zero temperatures forecast
news.summary: The weather has turned colder with the risk of snow and ice in parts of the UK as Simon King explains.
